alert.note: Alert for Ozark; Taney (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 13 at 2:59AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Missouri, including the following counties, Ozark and Taney. * WHEN...Until 900 AM CDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 259 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - This includes the following low water crossings... Trigger Creek at Highway J, Caney Creek at Caney Creek RD, Stout Creek at Hulls Ford Road, Bear Creek at Reno Springs Road, Wolf Creek at Highway 125, Roark Creek at Expressway Lane and Little Beaver Creek at Old Cheese Plant Road. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Branson, Forsyth, Hollister, Merriam Woods, Rockaway Beach, Taneyville, Kissee Mills, Bull Creek, Kirbyville, Powersite, Ozark Beach, Edgewater Beach, Bradleyville, Rueter, Walnut Shade, Protem, Brownbranch, Lake Taneycomo, Bull Shoals Lake, Table Rock Lake and Shepherd of the Hills State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
